intro: Asyneuma trichocalycinum, commonly known as the woolly asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Asyneuma trichocalycinum produces small, yellowish flowers that attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
